def merge_sort(li, c):
    if len(li) < 2: return li 
    m = len(li) / 2 
    return merge(merge_sort(li[:m],c), merge_sort(li[m:],c),c) 

def merge(l, r, c):
	result = []
	while l and r:
		s = l if l[0] <= r[0] else r
		result.append(s.pop(0))
		if (s == r):
			c[0] += len(l)
	result.extend(l if l else r)
	return result
				
count = [0]
num_elems = int(raw_input())
assert 1 <= num_elems <= 100000
elems = map(int, raw_input().split())
#assert all(map(lambda x: 1 <= x <= 1000000, elems))
merge_sort(elems, count)
print count[0]
